meanings.definition: A person who specializes in the study of fetology.
meanings.sent1: The fetologists carefully examine the growth of the baby in the mother's belly.
meanings.sent2: Many fetologists work in hospitals to help understand the development of unborn babies.
meanings.sent3: The fetologists joked that they could probably identify a baby's age just by looking at an ultrasound.
meanings.sent4: She was known as the fetologist of the family, always able to predict the baby's gender with accuracy.
meanings.sent5: The fetologists' dedication to understanding fetal development is truly admirable.

meanings.definition: The field of study that focuses on the development of the fetus.
meanings.sent1: In college, she decided to major in fetology to learn more about fetal growth.
meanings.sent2: The university offers a comprehensive course on fetology for aspiring doctors.
meanings.sent3: During the conference, experts in fetology discussed the latest research on fetal health.
meanings.sent4: The professor's passion for fetology was evident in every lecture she gave.
meanings.sent5: The textbook on fetology provided a detailed overview of fetal development stages.
